pageProps.content:
![Mureunggyegok Valley (Î¨¥Î¶âÍ≥ÑÍ≥°)](/2022-10-06-1665033039678/2660876_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Mureunggyegok Valley, between Dutasan Mountain and Cheongoksan Mountain, refers to a four-kilometer stretch from Hoamso Pond to Yongchupokpo Falls upstream. The waters of Mureunggyegok Valley flow over wide sheets of rock and into the cracks between them, forming large and particularly nice ponds along the path. Starting at Mureung Rock, a wide sheet of single rock on which hundreds can sit, the valley trail twists and turns as it passes Samhwasa Temple, Haksodae, Ongnyudong, and Seonnyeotang Ravine, all the way to Ssangpokpo and Yongchupokpo Falls, providing breathtaking scenery along the way. Also known as Arcadia, scholars and poets frequented the valley in times past, and the 5,000 square meters of Mureung Rock bears the inscribed names of some of these poets and their work. The valley offers a medley of curious-looking rocks and stones, and other odd scenery that attracts many tourists. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Korea Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
‚Ä¢ For more info: +82-33-539-3700| |parking:|Available| |usetime:|09:00-18:00
* July-August 06:00-20:00
* November-February 08:00-17:00| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Hiking Course:|[Course 1] Management Office ‚Üí Samhwasa Temple ‚Üí Haksodae ‚Üí Gwaneumpokpo Falls ‚Üí Ongnyudong (25min one-way)
[Course 2] Management Office ‚Üí Ongnyudong ‚Üí Seonnyeotang Ravine ‚Üí Ssangpokpo Falls, Yongchupokpo Falls (40min one-way)
[Course 3] Management Office ‚Üí Ongnyudong ‚Üí Dutasanseong Fortress Entrance ‚Üí Dutasanseong Fortress (50min one-way)
[Course 4] Management Office ‚Üí Samhwasa Temple ‚Üí Gwaneumam Hermitage Entrance ‚Üí Gwaneumam Hermitage (50min one-way)| |Restrooms:|Available| |Parking Fees:|Small vehicles 2,000 won / Large vehicles 5,000 won| |Admission Fees:|Individuals: Adults 2,000 won / Teenagers 1,500 won / Children 700 won
Groups: Adults 1,500 won / Teenagers 1,000 won / Children 500 won

* Group: 30 people or more
* Free admission: Senior citizens (ages 65 and older), Preschoolers (ages 6 and under)| ## Detail Image ![/2022-10-06-1665033039678/2613064_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-06-1665033039678/2613064_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-10-06-1665033039678/2613067_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-06-1665033039678/2613067_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-10-06-1665033039678/2660877_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-06-1665033039678/2660877_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-10-06-1665033039678/2660878_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-06-1665033039678/2660878_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-10-06-1665033039678/2660879_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-06-1665033039678/2660879_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-33-539-3700](tel:+82335393700) - [üè†www.dhsisul.org](http://www.dhsisul.org/) ```googleMap latitude: 37.4640430993 longitude: 129.0158009877 title: 538, Samhwa-ro, Donghae-si, Gangwon-do ``` ## Directions [Bus]
From Dong Seoul Bus Terminal, take a bus to Donghae Bus Terminal.
From Donghae Bus Terminal, take a local bus bound for Mureunggyegok Valley.

data.title: Mureunggyegok Valley (Î¨¥Î¶âÍ≥ÑÍ≥°)
data.description: Mureunggyegok Valley, between Dutasan Mountain and Cheongoksan Mountain, refers to a four-kilometer stretch from Hoamso Pond to Yongchupokpo Falls upstream. The waters of Mureunggyegok Valley flow over wide sheets of rock and into the cracks between them, forming large and particularly nice ponds along the path. Starting at Mureung Rock, a wide sheet of single rock on which hundreds can sit, the valley trail twists and turns as it passes Samhwasa Temple, Haksodae, Ongnyudong, and Seonnyeotang Ravine, all the way to Ssangpokpo and Yongchupokpo Falls, providing breathtaking scenery along the way. Also known as Arcadia, scholars and poets frequented the valley in times past, and the 5,000 square meters of Mureung Rock bears the inscribed names of some of these poets and their work. The valley offers a medley of curious-looking rocks and stones, and other odd scenery that attracts many tourists.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Taebaek Guwau Village (Alpine Botanical Garden) (ÌÉúÎ∞± Íµ¨ÏôÄÏö∞ÎßàÏùÑ(Í≥†ÏõêÏûêÏÉùÏãùÎ¨ºÏõê))
dataList.description:
Guwau Village is located below Pijae Hill (also called Samsuryeong) at the entrance to Maebongsan Mountain. The village got its name because its topography resembles the scenery of nine cows peacefully lying around. The Alpine Botanical Garden is located 800-900 meters above sea level and protects the endangered alpine plant species from disappearing.

The botanical garden also offers visitors an opportunity to conveniently observe some rare flowers and plants. In August, when the sunflowers are in full bloom, the Taebaek Sunflower Festival is held at Guwau Village. In addition to celebrating the area‚Äôs wide array of colorful flowers, the festival also has a variety of attractions such as a drawing exhibition, a photo exhibition, and an environmental sculpture exhibition using repurposed materials.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Taebaek Coal Museum (ÌÉúÎ∞±ÏÑùÌÉÑÎ∞ïÎ¨ºÍ¥Ä)
dataList.description: Taebaek Coal Museum is located where coal was first discovered within Korea. While coal has declined in use, the resource served an important role in the modernization of the nation. The museum is a place where you can learn about the history of Korea‚Äôs coal industry through well-organized exhibitions.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Sutasa Temple (ÏàòÌÉÄÏÇ¨)
dataList.description:
Gongjaksan Mountain (887 m), home to Sutasa Temple and named for its resemblance to a peacock proudly displaying its tail feathers, gives visitors a bird‚Äôs-eye-view of Hongcheon. From the bottom, Gongjaksan Mountain looks like a giant laying on his back, looking up to the sky. The mountain offers elegant azaleas in spring, beautiful fall foliage, majestic cliffs with unusual rocks, colonies of pine trees, and a serene snowscape in winter.

Sutasa Valley, stretching over 12 kilometers between Sutasa Temple and Nocheon-ri, is full of large ponds and broad bedrocks and is flanked by rocky cliffs and pine groves.

Located among the foothills, Sutasa Temple is an ancient temple built by Monk Wonhyo in AD 708. The temple boasts numerous cultural properties including the gabled roof of Daejeokgwangjeon, a bronze bell, a three-tiered pagoda, and Wolinseokbo, a biography of Buddha that has been designated as a National Treasure.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Sundamgyegok Valley (ÏàúÎã¥Í≥ÑÍ≥°)
dataList.description: Located 5 kilometers northwest of Cheorwon-gun Office, Sundamgyegok Valley is one of the most beautiful valleys among the branches of the Hantangang River. It offers fantastic scenery of fascinating rock formations, steep cliffs, and ponds. The valley is filled with abundant water, trimmed by rare naturally white sand. Also, the stream behind the valley attracts many rafters each year.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Sun Cruise Theme Park (Ïç¨ÌÅ¨Î£®Ï¶à ÌÖåÎßàÍ≥µÏõê)
dataList.description: Sun Cruise Resort is a cruise-shaped resort located on a cliff 60 meters above sea level. Surrounding the resort is an extensive park, with themed gardens and sculptures. The park offers an exquisite landscape with its large man-made lake and coconut trees. The resort also has a sculpture park that displays 30 sculptures and a jangseung (traditional Korean totem pole) park with 250 jangseung totems from Andong. Visitors can also stop for a cup of coffee at a train-themed cafe or a sailboat-themed cafe.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Statue of Soyanggang Maid (ÏÜåÏñëÍ∞ïÏ≤òÎÖÄÏÉÅ)
dataList.description: This Soyanggang Maiden Statue stands high between Soyanggang Skywalk and Soyang i(2)gyo Bridge. This statue, representing Korea‚Äôs popular song Soyanggang Cheonyeo (maiden), is 12 m high in total, combining 5 m-high base stone and 7 m-high body. If you see it close to, the statue looks very big. The statue depicts a maiden who holds her skirt hem with one hand and reed with the other, and her breast-knot flapping in the wind. The base stone has the inscription of lyrics. The lyrics belong to the song Soyanggang Cheonyeo composed by Ban Ya-wol, who left hit songs, such as Crossing the Teary Pass of Bakdaljae, and Brokenhearted Miari Ridge.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Soyangho Lake Ferry (ÏÜåÏñëÌò∏ Ïú†ÎûåÏÑ†)
dataList.description: Soyangho Lake was created by the building of Soyanggang Dam in 1973, and holds approximately 2.7 billion tons of water. It is the largest lake in Korea, earning it the nickname of the inland sea. Islands dot the landscape, and the lake is home to over 50 types of freshwater fish, making it a popular destination for watersports and fishing.
dataList.author: korea-tour
